publishedfiledetails.title: Media Player
publishedfiledetails.description:
Watch videos or listen to music with friends in Sandboxâ€”based on the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=118824086]Cinema gamemode[/url].

[h1]Features[/h1]
[list]
[*] Synchronized media playback
[*][b] Supported services:[/b] YouTube, Twitch, SoundCloud, SHOUTcast
[*] [b]Supported files:[/b] mp3, wav, ogg, jpg, png, webm
[*] Intuitive queue and request interface
[*] Multiple active media players
[*] Dupe and save support; see [url=http://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/546392647/496880503072814671/]playlists[/url]
[*] Queue repeat and shuffle modes
[/list]

[h1]Installation[/h1]
The [url=http://get.adobe.com/flashplayer/otherversions/]NPAPI version of Adobe Flash Player[/url] is required for Twitch playback. Mac OS X is not supported by the Media Player addon, sorry ([url=https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod-issues/issues/1347]reason[/url]).

[h1]Usage[/h1]
1. Spawn the Big Screen TV from the spawn menu ('Entities' tab > 'Media Player' category).
2. Press use (E) on the TV to turn it on.
3. Hold C while looking at the TV to reveal the media queue.
4. Press the 'Add Media' button.
5. Navigate to a supported media page and press the 'Request URL' button.
6. Watch!

[h1]Console Variables[/h1]
mediaplayer_3daudio 0/1
mediaplayer_allow_webpages 0/1
mediaplayer_fullscreen 0/1
mediaplayer_mute_unfocused 0/1
mediaplayer_volume 0.0-1.0

[h1]FAQ[/h1]
[b]Q:[/b] Can the ads be closed on YouTube?
[b]A:[/b] Yes. While in Sandbox, hold C to reveal the mouse cursor. Then simply click the 'x' on the ad that appears on the media player screen.

[b]Q:[/b] How do I adjust the screen brightness?
[b]A:[/b] The screen brightness is either caused by bloom or HDR. Try typing "pp_bloom 0" in console.

[b]Q:[/b] Can I play local files from my harddrive?
[b]A:[/b] Audio files are supported, but other players won't be able to hear them. You can request the full file path using the "Request a supported URL" text box (e.g. C:/Music/filename.mp3). Files with unicode characters are not supported due to a GMod bug.

[b]Q:[/b] Why doesn't this work for Mac?
[b]A:[/b] The Garry's Mod developers need to fix issues with the in-game browser on Mac. [url=https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod-requests/issues/531]Follow progress on GitHub.[/url]

[h1]Links[/h1]
[url=https://github.com/pixeltailgames/gm-mediaplayer]Source Code[/url]
[url=https://github.com/pixeltailgames/gm-mediaplayer/wiki/Getting-Started]Brief Developer Getting Started Guide[/url]
[url=http://www.gametracker.com/search/garrysmod/?search_by=server_variable&search_by2=mediaplayer_allow_webpages&query=&loc=_all&sort=0&order=ASC&searchipp=50]Servers using the Media Player addon[/url]

[url=https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=ER75ZWB434RVJ][img]https://www.paypalobjects.com/en_US/i/btn/btn_donate_LG.gif[/img][/url]

[h1]Additional Credits[/h1]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/clopsy]Clopsy[/url] for design of the playback menu.
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/MacDGuy]MacDGuy[/url] for the Big Screen TV model.

[h1][b]Having an issue? Please post steps to reproduce in the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/546392647/496880503059475138/]bug report discussion[/url], including any media links that you may have used. Issues relating to Mac can't be fixed as it's something Garry's Mod developers need to address.[/b][/h1]
